content: 19/02/21 V 13.6 STILL UNABLE to upload photos. GoodSAM crashing every time I try to upload photo of new AED location to the app. Duty hours increasing when not on duty.😔 Still using Google Pixel phone.
replyContent: Dear Alan, in order to upload an AED, you need to take a photo with the location on. (And your photo library app needs to have access to your location to tag the photo.) We then use the geolocation information on the image to know where the AED is, without this, the app will not work because it would not know where the AED is located.

content: Poor
replyContent: Dear Eric, sorry if you feel that way, based on your review you are using an old version of the app, you may want to update. The app is designed to be simple for all age groups and run on as many devices as possible. Any constructive feedback is greatly appreciated!

content: Wow, OK, so the developer response to reviews that calls out a forced square crop on the licence says "take a photo of your licence and the table it is sitting on, so you can crop a combination of the license and the background it to a square". See Richard M's review below as an example. Yet the photo of the AED allows for any size and shape crop. So the developers have figured out how to allow an any size crop for selecting one photo, but don't want to apply that to another? I'm betting that the reason I can't save my AED location is because the app doesn't just select a photo, it selects and forces a crop, and in cropping it, it probably loses the location data that is in the Exif information that I have confirmed is embedded in the original photo.
replyContent: Dear Bernard, the app can accept multiple type of licenses and certificates (based on the chosen organisation) and they come in all shapes and sizes, please move the camera slightly back to include the whole license. If we make it a horizontal rectangle, it wont work for organisations who need a square or vertical certificates.

content: Had so much Grief with this app. Had no alerts for so long is forgot it was installed. My circumstances changed so needed to edit what I was able to help with, app wouldn't allow this. Regrettably had to uninstall.
replyContent: Dear Nelly, the app connects you to nearby tasks based on your location and roles, we can not guarantee the number of tasks that an individual receives as that purely depends on the demand. Also the app does not allow you to edit the safeguarding information such as the address or ID, this can be achieved by calling the support line on 08081963382.

content: The AED upload function doesn't work on my phone. Every time I go to upload a geo-tagged picture it crashes, regardless of crop size. Geo-tagging is also often inaccurate, so should be replaced with manual location entry.
replyContent: Hi Daniel, sorry to hear this, does the app have access to your photo gallery? Also the geo-tag is used for safeguarding so out team can cross check the location, we would alter the coordinates on our side and encourage users to provide as much information necessary in the "Additional information" section. We hope that helps!

content: Great app
replyContent: Thank you very much!

content: I got another siren today at 11:42. I immediately opened the app to accept, but a message told me as I had not responded it had been given to someone else. Again the alert came 40 minutes AFTER the request. I got a "siren" on my phone for the first time the other day at 13:50. I responded straight away, however the task was requested at 13:10 and was given to someone else as they stated I hadn't responded. Why did I get the alert 40 minutes AFTER the request? Very disappointed!
replyContent: Dear Barbara, the app relies on an internet connection to deliver the notifications, if your phone does not have an internet connection (like 3g) and is not connected to wifi it can not receive the notifications on time; in this cases the notifications would be delayed until your device gets connected to the internet. We hope that helps!

content: I spent nearly an hour calling people before someone actually needed assistance. Not very good use of my time. After spending 5 hours on this app, I only physically helped 2 people. replyContent: Dear Ali, none of the above is apps fault? The app simply matches what is put into the system by the NHS health and care worker with the closest volunteers around them, if the referral wants to come off the system, it is their call and you or them need to call the help line. Regarding the range, please reduce the maximum distance from the ID tab.

content: Version 12.8 on Android 10: looks like notifications may have been fixed, although now when I receive a task I get a "double ding" where my notification sound plays twice, almost over the top of itself. replyContent: Hi Keith, regarding the "double ding", thats because you have the toggle "Notify me even when silent" turned on, which means one sound would be played via the notification and one through the alarm system to override the silent mode. I updated the app a couple of days ago and all the responders arnd me were no longer visible, also my on duty hours stopped updating yday, but seem to be working today. This does not seem a reliable app.
Hi folks, please only list what the new updates are under the What's new section rather than the long blurb about what the app is about. Thanks!

Initially ok but can't tell now if still working. All ok from end-March initial download until this Monday (11th May) then stopped recognising I was logged in as available. Reloaded with latest version on Tues but only randomly recognises I'm available. Logged in as available for 8 hours today but hours logged only moved from 282 to 284. Is there a problem?
Not very user friendly!

I am a check in and chat volunteer. My hours have frozen. I was told that I had rejected a call that I had received no alert for. It is certainly not perfect, far from it. It would be good to be able to see who needs help before accepting an alert as we are not supposed to help the same person more than twice in four weeks. I have reported all this and got only vague answers. I haven't had many alerts as it happens so I am going to opt out for a while.

I have just accepted my 1st job after 690 hours after contacted the person job disappeared from the app and on the top only 3 options I can see Me , around me , comms. I have tried to contact royal voluntary service for further advice but no one avaliable. luckily 1 wrote done the details of the person and going to help the old lady who hasn't got money and have nothing to eat. Please sort this app out thanks.

Update: hours total has suddenly updated, adding 5 hours. (?) Volunteering Hours frozen since last update, even though On Duty toggle is "On", so no idea if I'm on or off duty. Almost irrelevant anyway as not had a single alert in over 300 hours standing by. I know that isn't the developers fault - they only provide the app - but the whole idea has been badly thought through. A huge waste of manpower, resources and people's good intentions when there are obviously people out there needing help.
replyContent:
Hi there, the voluntary hours is an estimate, it in no way affect any of the functionalities within the app. 

NHS and RVS are working hard to increase the awareness and referrals, number of tasks are increasing day by day... sorry it takes some time.

Hope that helps!

content: A big waste of resources and good will. The app is clunky and not transparent. It would be good to see how many alerts have recently gone out by area and what demand there is for the responders like me. Any data or feedback of the work responders are doing would be useful. I suggest reaching out to your local community independently. You can do more good that way. This centralised bureaucratic approach is not working. It has the feel and interface of a cold lethargic institution incapable of understanding frontline needs. Good in theory and great publicity but poor execution.

Functionality is terrible, communications disappear if you pass on or say you are on site, which means a slight mis-step means the responder loses all the messages and /or cannot comment further. Not intuitive an app. to use
replyContent: Hi Martyn, this is for complying with all the privacy and GDPR and patient information confidentiality. Why would you need to have access to the patient information if you pass it to another volunteer?

content: I have the latest version of the app as of today (May 12th), but it constantly crashes. I responded to an alert in the app, then it crashed and I couldn't even get back in to get the contact info for the patient or pass it to another responder. I'm concerned that people who need urgent help aren't able to get it, every other responder I know is having the same issue. The app is entirely useless and unusable in its current state.
replyContent:
Dear Joe, Google provide us developers with crash logs but sadly we cant see any crashes coming through.

If the app crashes please report it, we can not see any reports from your device and the app is functioning as it should for the rest of the users, cheers.

content: It works pretty well, simple to use, would be nice to see previous information on calls as people inputting the data have telephone numbers in the wrong boxes so it would save others doing the same investigative work to get the correct contact details.
App is OK, pity the service is not used, 640 hours on duty and nothing yet the government made such a fuss about how many signed up, checked with others and the same, no use.

Updated review: My presence does not appear on the map despite all public settings activated. It might be that an anonymous responder corresponding to my gps location is me, but then that would mean the 'reveal' settings are broken. As such I can't tell if this even works. I've logged 135hrs with so far no requests.
replyContent: Hi there, what exactly is broken? appreciate if you could provide a feedback which we could work on! cheers

content: Over 900 hours never been contacted in all that time
replyContent: Hi there, there have been around 2200 alerts going out today, we have had 300,000 responders reporting on duty, most tasks were matched to the nearest Responder within 10/15 meters! Please stay on duty and be patient... we are increasing the number of Alerts rapidly, hopefully you get one soon. (Not having tasks near you is really not our fault!)

content: Works fine IF you read the instructions sent to us all via email. Admittedly it could be easier to use, if they'd had time to start from scratch. However alerts time out too quickly after you have accepted it, which is understandable for cardiac arrests but not really for prescription drop off (for example).

Using this for the NHS Volunteering Service. Whilst not massive intuitive to use (when a call comes through, you cannot see the details of the call from the tab you are taken to, you need to know to look somewhere else) it does the job.
replyContent:
Hi Graham, the number for the person should be in the Comms tab, please contact them first in order to figure out what they need.

There is also the number for the support centre in the Comms tab, you can always call them to raise an issue, cheers!

content: Doesn't work. Logged over 4000 hrs of volunteering and never had an alert. Today elderly person in house opposite me collapsed and the first I knew was when an NHS volunteer first responder arrived at the address followed by a fire service first responder. Checked the app, all apparently working but no alert ! Maybe I could have helped.
replyContent:
Hi Rob, Are you a medical Responder? Some ambulances have temporarily paused notifying Responders due to C19. The NHS volunteer first responders also use our platform. 

In order for the app to notify you, you need to have it running in the background and you need to allow the app to access your location and be able to send you a push notification.

content: Took a little while to get the hang of it but now it's very easy to use and a great way for people to volunteer and help the NHS & people who are vulnerable and elderly 👍

I'm a new volunteer, have just downloaded the app on a Samsung Galaxy Core Prime, but can't proceed any further. The log-in page seems too big for my screen, so I've got the top and the bottom, but not the crucial middle part which allows me to log in. It's very disappointing, as I'm anxious to start.

I'm not really understanding how can we help people when they ask 4 help .i had an alert from someone who needed help but doesn't show an address or telephone number to contact the person in need.. i went there knocking on doors but couldn't find the one .. the neighbor's thought i was a thief, didn't believe this app .almost put me in trouble
replyContent: Hi there, please refer to your guides, they can be found on: https://www.goodsamapp.org/assets/pdf/GoodSAMNHSVolunteerinFAQs.pdf

content: Been on duty for 815 hrs and not had a shout. The whole process implemented by the RVS is a shambles. The app has lots of issues, most of the time it just gets stuck updating the map. I don't think the app is sending alerts to my phone, surly my area most have had some requests by those isolating!! Also I keep hearing on the news that the care industry needs assistance with PPE deliveries so why isn't the RVS responding with volunteer drivers? There needs to be a public enquiry after covid19 end
I have clocked up nearly 400 hours of volunteering and not one call to date.

The app closes itself regularly, so I'm not actually staying on duty for any length of time. The simulator does nothing more than sound an alarm, you don't get to see the whole process. Not fit for purpose currently.
replyContent:
Hi Elizabeth, the app is not closing itself, its your device/power management which kills it. 

Nevertheless the state of your "On-duty/Off-duty" is stored on the server so you will still be alerted if there a nearby task. 

Cheers!

content: Depending on the answer I get from the volunteer service I will be uninstalling this app. 418 hours on duty and not one tasking. Feel like I'm part of a government pr ruse. Thanks for the reply and I quite understand but I can't give a better rating because it reflects on WVS and not the app. Sorry. I'm uninstalling it now.
replyContent: Hi Andy, you not getting tasks is not a problem with the app/platform! We have had 750k volunteer and currently having around 4k of tasks per day. We cant send you tasks if we simply don't have them or don't know about them... It's up to NHS and RVS on how they on board these tasks and who is eligible for the support. Your 1 star makes us sad.

content: fab app
As yet I have not been able to get the app. It is always waiting to install very frustrating as I have been accepted to help.
replyContent:
Hi Helen, if the app is not installing on your phone, it is a problem with Google Play or your phone. Does it have enough space?

Sadly this is not an issue with out app.

content: I need to be able to notes to an issue. Just now I called the person needing help, several times and couldn't get through. If that happens, or if they no longer need help, or some other issue, "drop the call" misses so much information and just puts the next Responder in the same position as me. Also there needs to be a way to silence that bloody siren sound! Just pressing any button on the phone, or having a button appear on the screen "Stop" as it can't be stopped
replyContent: Hi Luke, thank you for the feedback, we will raise this with the RVS team as they are in charge of how the alerting process should work. Thank you for volunteering!

content: 200+ hours on duty & only once had to go and help someone. However, the app has twice alerted me when my phone has been off, but I hadn't turned the on-duty tab to 'OFF' first. replyContent:
Dear Caroline, we were not paid to "develop an app", the app has been there for seven year. :)

If you could explain what your issue is, we might be able to resolve it for you, cheers.

content: Seems to be working better now although I've received no calls as yet.

What exactly is expected of me when I "accept" a call ??? I run to the "scene", ie some point given on the map, only to be looking around at buildings and people like an alien on a new planet. By that time, I still don't know, what house, nor who, nor what help is needed. Once I saw some name&number to call (which didn't work) but appeared to be an alert from days ago then more days later the comms page confirmed the number wasn't working??? Messages appear and disappear. No help. A mess.
replyContent:
Please refer to your guides that have been sent out by RVS when registering.

It is fundamental for all volunteers to follow the guides, rules and the local laws.

If you have lost them, please find the links to the appropriate guides here: https://www.goodsamapp.org/assets/pdf/GoodSAMNHSVolunteerinFAQs.pdf

content: Still having problems with the app not working properly. And unless you check the app regularly to see if it is working, you have no idea if it is or isn't and possibly missing calls for help!

Extremely baffling. I've had a couple of alerts (nearly getting a heart attack from the air raid siren alarm!) but they just consist of a picture of a person with a broken leg, a distance, and ACCEPT/REJECT. There's not enough information to know what is needed, and whether I can help or not.
replyContent:
Dear Paul, you need to accept the Alert/Task before being able to see further information and the persons detail.

This is because of privacy and GDPR laws, we need to differentiate between a Responder who has not seen the information at all and the one who has seen the information before passing it to another volunteer.

content: The app seems better now it's been refined to meet volunteer needs however, it's stopped increasing my volunteer hours, been on duty all day and it's only added 1 hour. Makes me wonder if the app goes to sleep with the phone and whether this may stop me receiving an alert
Seems to be up and running and working ok after initial teething issues. However, after nearly 200 hours of being on-call, I've still not had a call-out. Perhaps the demand is low...
replyContent:
Hi Samual, sorry for the confusions, the functions of the app purely depends on who you parent organisation is. If you are under RVS/BRC, voluntary hours go up when you switch on duty.

Under other organisations you have voluntary hours and on-duty hours, if you are not on duty the first one goes up and if you are on duty then the latter goes up.

content: Great App. Working spot on.

replyContent:
Hi Georgina, can you try a simulation and press the "Volume up" button? This would allow you to adjust the volume. 

Also you can turn on the "Play siren even when on silent" option on your ID tab to make sure you wont miss the alerts if your phone is on silent.

content: Change the alert sound for Royal Volunteers, they aren't necessarily major events so doesn't need that really loud siren - please!!!!!

replyContent: Hi Gary, the app has been trimmed to only show the functions required for volunteering to volunteers. What functions do you think you are missing?

content: I'm having trouble. Can some explain the difference between "on sceen" and "with patient". Why do you have to accept the alert before you are told the alert details. This app is totally illogical!
replyContent:
Hi Chris, You need to accept the alert before seeing the patient details due to patient confidentiality and privacy laws.

The "One Scene" and "With patient" have the same function, it depends on the nature of the task, for some tasks one is more relevant than other, you can press either of the buttons.

content: UDATED REVIEW 25/04/20: I had tried updating the app to the latest version (11.1) by allowing Google Play to carry out the update automatically. Unfortunately this did not fix the issue. content: Latest update - if it isn't loading up for you, going into settings and clear the app data and cache for both Responder and Google Maps will clear it up and get it going again. There's a known issue and Google are working on a fix, but the above will keep you going until it does.
replyContent: The app needs access to your location services, there is also a bar on the "ID" tab (the first tab from the left) which allows you to adjust the location accuracy. Hope this helps!

content: Still not able to get on! Three days after registering I'm still being told they haven't verified my identity yet! I guess they have large numbers to process... Have been verified now (weeks ago) but still no alerts/call outs, despite Boots telling me they could do with more drivers....!(?)

App is good and seems to do it's job well. Clearly there's more people willing to help that need helping which can only be a good thing. Hoping I will be able to help at some point but also hoping that there's no one that needs help!
I can't find the sam app, only the sam responder who are willing to help those in needs... how does this work?? ..

Was confused when I registered & installed app as it’s purely designed around volunteers with medical expertise , I.e. qualified responders - whereas as I have no medical training whatsoever & simply volunteered to deliver medications or whatever to people isolated in community . I checked up on app again after I heard that volunteer network was now properly up & running but still seems totally slanted towards medics so I’m anxious about getting appropriate tasks to respond to.
replyContent:
Hi Des, sorry for the confusion, The nature of the tasks which you receive depends on your organisation, if you have registered under Royal Volunteering Services then you will only receive volunteering tasks. Here is a video which helps:

https://www.facebook.com/goodsamapp/videos/217269872881763/UzpfSTUwMjM1MTM2MzE3NjM1NDoyOTcwNTg4NzQ2MzUyNTkx/

content: NHS Volunteer Responder - Very impressed with this App. Simple to use, and without any bugs (an achievement considering the short time frame to roll this out as a national initiative). Completed my first response yesterday with no problems at all. Looking forward to the next one! 😁

Any chance to reduce the volume of the alert? It has just gone off for the first time and scared the living daylights out of me. At this rate, I may be one requiring assistance. Seriously, it's really piercing and would be so much better to be able to reduce the volume. Thanks for the very speedy response. Simulating an alert and reducing the volume when going off has worked (and a little embarrassed I hadn't thought of that...) Cheers
replyContent:
Hi Adrian, sorry about that! If you open the app, you can use the "Simulation" button and the volume buttons to adjust the volume. Basically simulate an incident and press the volume down button to reduce the volume.

Hope that helps!

content: App no longer works Since the update to version 11 released on 21/04/20 the app doesn't load just gives you a loading screen also the report tab is now missing
replyContent:
Hi Michael, Reporting tab being removed from the volunteers app is a feature as it was not relevant for voluntary roles.

Our app requires internet to be able to load your settings and nearby information, could you make sure you are either on a WIFI or have 3g/4g on your phone?

content: Quick and smple to use.
Yes, now found the location with a link supplied.
replyContent:
Hi there, the app requires access to your location services, please make sure location services are turned on and the app has access to them.

There is also a slider on the first tab allowing you to adjust your location service accuracy. 

Hope that helps!

content: Shows my hours as zero no option to change it. Question answered now Thank you

Hi Shirley, the voluntary hours go up automatically as long as you hare switched "On duty" and have the app running in the background.

The guide can be found here: https://www.goodsamapp.org/assets/pdf/NHS_GoodSAM_App.pdf

Hope that helps!

content: I want it to work but the latest update has broken the app! Updated just now 200420 and app opens but no longer become active and remains on map screen with never ending spinning disc! I wanted to volunteer so signed up, so far no alerts and now not even the app works so was there really any point in getting 3/4 mill sign ups when truth is RVS were not ready for this? A lot of people with good intentions now sitting doing nothing many of whom l, like me, were volunteering in other areas. 😠
replyContent:
Hi Marc, when the app opens, it tries to fetch your information and nearby responders from the server, if you have poor or no internet connection then this can take longer.

Also we are doing our best, RVS is doing their best also, promise!  Having the GoodSAM app does not prevent anyone from volunteering elsewhere, we all are just trying to help.

content: Patience is a virtue. Please don't down-rate the app simply because you haven't received an alert. There are about 20 responders within a 100m radius of me, I'm not surprised I've not been alerted, other people must be closer, which makes sense right? Also, if there isn't a task suited to me, that isn't anyone's fault, I'm just happy to be on standby should one arrive. Dear app developers, thanks for the recent UI simplification, nice and clean.

they somehow managed to delete my account after I had been verified and showed as on duty. If a glitch deleted me it may have deleted hundreds or thousands of others. After weeks of chasing this up, no support whatsoever. Volunteer instead with local authorities. To the developers reply, No I didn't. Nothing changed, my login stopped working and your site no longer recognises my email address.
replyContent:
Hi Brian, did you change your organisation?

Every time you change your organisation, the admins of the selected organisation will then need to review and approve your account.

It may be that they have rejected your application.

content: Don't like having the siren on as it really makes me jump when it goes off. Don't get me wrong if you are a trained medical person it is probably a good idea but as i am a volunteer community responser it would be better to have a different alert as I've had to silence it therefore I miss the requests that come through. Update. Much better since I have been able to choose my own tone. I and everyone around me will no longer jump when the alert goes off (i was worse than the fire alarm at work)
replyContent: Hi Louise, sure, we will try to add more tunes, most people want the siren as otherwise they will miss the alert. We are trying to maintain a balance. Thank you for volunteering!

content: Ok app for the emergency situation the UK NHS is trying to cope with to organise community volunteers. It was providing an accurate location for me but has now located me permanently across town for several days even though the locator bar is on high sensitivity. This will mean I will not get call outs near to me????

Instructions? I guess the guys behind this app are very busy given the number of people that have kindly signed up. It's not clear when / how / if I will be notified if someone needs help. Developers have done well though, bet they never imagined this many people using it and it's not completely fallen over, crashes etc when I open it. Then again, it doesn't seem to actually have much functionality, I'm guessing it does but has to be unlocked.
replyContent:
Hi Robert,

replyContent:
Hi Alan, it simply depends on which organisation you belong to.

If you are under "Royal voluntary service" then you will be alerted to voluntary tasks as you signed up for.

If you are under "London ambulance services" for example, you will be alerted to emergencies. 

Hope that helps!

I have signed up as an NHS volunteer responder. The app is so flawed that it will significantly hamper the ability for people to help. I have read all of the PDF guides and they haven't helped. Below are the issues I have. I work in User Experience and am happy to help you, feel free to contact me. 1) When I receive an alert that my help is needed, it simply asks me to 'ACCEPT' or 'REJECT'. I need to know what the request is for before I can respond. 2) I load the app and toggle 'on' my availability. If I click the app sometime later, it seems to load from scratch with my availability toggled 'off'. I need the app to be explicit to me about how my availability is managed. Does my 'availability on' state persist even when the app is no longer running? If so, tell me. If so, make it persist when I reload the app. As it stands, it feels as though my availability has somehow expired because it is toggled off when I reload the app. 3) Android asks me if the app can see my location 'while the app is loaded' or 'all the time'. I want to minimise the amount of location data I share with apps. Make it clear to me what I should select in this context and why.

content: Maybe I've just been lucky, but I've followed instructions to the letter from GoodSam at every point, waited for a couple of weeks in total and have been able to use this app exactly as described to show my availability for helping out. I think some people may have unrealistic expectations about how long it takes to get everyone up and running.

Firstly, I know that there are some serious mitigating circumstances at the moment, so that has to be taken into account. That said, I signed up as an NHS Volunteer, was approved and accepted, and was then told to download this app, which I duly did. As requested, I've been trying to upload my profile photo, and after 20 attempts, still no joy. It IS a JPEG, less than 1Mb, and all it does is repeatedly time out whilst displaying the 'uploading....please wait' icon. I've tried it at 'non peak' hours (i.e. 1am) and still nada. There seems to be absolutely minimal online support available either. Sorry for sounding like know-it-all project manager (I've rolled out more than my fair share of IT applications in my time), but to deploy to 750k people with no designated online support resources available seems absolutely crazy. It's asking for trouble and for reputational damage to the app itself, which you now seem to be getting in the reviews here. For Pete's sake, please get on top of it.

content: I do appreciate that being made the official NHS Corona Virus volunteer app will have put a huge strain on the GoodSam team. However, the app as it stands is not really fit for this purpose. I've yet to find a downloadable instruction document or Youtube video that explains how NHS Responders should use an app that was not initially designed with them in mind. The key issues: The On-Duty toggle switch. The instructions for emergency responders say you need to be 'on duty' to get calls, yet when you switch it on it says "this option will have no effect" - Huh? Am I therefore always on duty? Or never on duty?! If you switch it 'off' it says "You'll still be notified of nearby cardiac arrests" which brings me to the next point: It remains an emergency services app The language in the app assumes I'm part of the emergency services. I have no medical qualifications - I don't want to be dispatched to a cardiac arrest! I also don't want to be forced to click a button which says I know first aid! I wouldn't know which end of the patient was which! Similarly, the default notification tone is an ear-splitting emergency siren (seriously - the loudest noise my phone has ever made) and there is no alternative option. If I were being called to save a life it's understandable, but I'm expecting to be asked to pick up Tesco's shopping! For now, my phone is staying on silent, lest I be the one to have a heart attack! Volunteering Options As some other people have mentioned, there is no way to see (or change) the volunteering types you are signed up to do. If i can't leave the house today, but could do companionship volunteering over the phone, there is no way to indicate that. It's also unclear how I fulfill my duties as an equipment and supplies transport volunteer when the app says I'll only be called to events a few streets away. My local hospital is nearby, but farther than a few streets. Goodsam - Please tweak the current app to address these points, or if that's not possible in the time-frame available, please bring out a quick PDF or video to explain how to use the app effectively as it stands!
As the app is now being used for Covid-19 volunteering, the instructions about defribulators might confuse/alarm some users. Could these instructions be changed/simplified?

replyContent: Hi Alex, the app tries to keep a balance (based on accuracy slider) between knowing where you are and not draining your battery. For example if we try to track all the users to the nearest meter at all times, it will drain their batteries and wont make much of a different in terms of the app functionality. Accuracy of 100/200 meters is good enough!

content: Having same issue as every other android. Re installed many times on my s10. Both sets of hours haven't moved in over a week when i am booked on duty.and I'm not convinced it is working at all every time i click on the app everything has reset to off.
replyContent:
Hi, 

The voluntary hours wont accumulate if you are on Duty. The on Duty hours will accumulate as you go on and then off duty.

This can happen if you have switch the "on Duty" on and never turned it off after a week. The platform assumes you can not be on duty all the time without sleep... :)

If you turn the on duty off, your hours should go up!

replyContent: Dear Elma, sorry you have had trouble using the app. This can happen if your device has no reception or data plan. These notifications are sent with a reasonably short period of time and if your device is out of reach, only the last notification will be delivered. (This is decided by Google who powers your device notifications system.)

content: The amount of downloads speaks volumes, not enough people using it and I've looked back in since being away and all my settings are off, I cant edit anything, I'm a first responder not a good Sam so a bit disappointed, I'll be uninstalling it event though my CFR group recommend it.
replyContent: Hi James, we are sorry you are having trouble with the app. Could you re-install the app and give it all the permissions it requires? The app saves the setting in the device and if the permission is not granted then these settings will not be saved. (Hopefully if you re-install, give permissions and turn the options on, they will stay on)

could help) B) how would the app inform us of an event location say in a 
block of flats?
